allowDuplicatesAcrossWindowsDivHelp.description: Help text for allowDuplicatesAcrossWindowsDivHelp section of settings
allowDuplicatesAcrossWindowsDivHelp.message:
Selecting this option disables detection of duplicate tabs across Chrome windows. If enabled, Clutter Free will only detect duplicate tabs within the same window, and not if they are opened in a different one.

By default, the option is marked 'off', and Clutter Free detects and prevents duplicate tabs across Chrome Windows.

allow_listHelp.message:
The allow list lets you specify sites that are allowed to have duplicates.

By default, chrome://newtab/ and about:blank are in the allow list. It is recommended that you keep them in the allow list to prevent new tab closing issues on slower connections.

appDescription.message: Reduce tab clutter - prevent duplicate tabs, quickly search & switch tabs, and more...

aum_divHelp.message: Only available for supporters at the moment.

block_listHelp.message: The block list lets you specify sites that are not allowed to have duplicates. All other sites may have duplicate tabs.

ignoreHashDivHelp.description: Help text for ignoreHash section of settings
ignoreHashDivHelp.message:
When ignore hash is enabled, same URLs with different hash fragments are considered duplicates. For example, 'https://c306.net/' and 'https://c306.net/#all_links' will be considered duplicate URLs.

Many modern web apps use hash fragments to indicate different destinations within the same app. Enabling ignore hash may cause non-identical pages to close as duplicates on these web apps. For example, 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/abcd.../edit#gid=123456' and 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/abcd.../edit#gid=987654' are considered duplicates even though they refer to different sheets within the same spreadsheet.

Changing this setting may lead to data loss in certain cases.

ignoreQueryDivHelp.message:
When ignore query is enabled, same URLs with different query sections are considered duplicates. For example, 'https://c306.net/' and 'https://c306.net/?p=1231' will be considered duplicate URLs.

Query fragments are widely used to refer to different pages within the same website. Enabling ignore query may cause non-identical pages to close as duplicates. For example, 'https://www.amazon.co.uk/s?k=raspberry+pi' and 'https://www.amazon.co.uk/s?k=apple+pie' may be marked considered duplicates despite linking to different result pages.

Changing this setting may lead to data loss in certain cases.

keyboardCommandsDivHelp.description: Help text for showContextMenu section of settings
keyboardCommandsDivHelp.message:
You may control some extension actions using keyboard shortcuts while using Chrome.

Keyboard shortcuts are supported for following actions:

  1. Duplicate current tab: Alt+Shift+D
  2. Add current tab's URL to the allow list: Ctrl+Shift+L
  3. Switch between active and passive mode: Ctrl+Shift+Y

You may also change, or remove these shortcuts using the link provided.

Supporters may customise keyboard shortcut actions from over a dozen available actions.

meHelp.description: Help text for me section of settings

message_explanation_detailed_domain_bloc.message:
Domains block list provides a stricter level of tab control. When enabled, only one tab is allowed across all webpages for each domain in this list.

Subdomains, except 'www.', are treated as a different domain from the main domain.

For example: blocking 'google.com' will only allow one tab open with a URL beginning with 'https://google.com/...' or 'https://www.google.com/...'.

But tabs with, say, 'https://inbox.google.com/...' or 'https://drive.google.com/...' will not be blocked, and be treated as normal.

message_explanation_domain_block_list.message: Domains block list provides a stricter level of tab control. When enabled, only one tab is allowed across all webpages for each domain in this list.

message_supporters_only.message: This feature is only available to supporters at the moment.

moveOriginalTabDivHelp.description: Help text for moveOriginalTabDivHelp section of settings
moveOriginalTabDivHelp.message:
Helps decide where to place the original tab when the duplicate is closed. Options are

  1. Don't move the original tab - keep it's current position,
  2. Move the original tab to end of the window, and
  3. Move the original tab to where the duplicate would've appeared. This is usually after the current tab.

options_advanced_allow_duplicates_across.message: Allow duplicate tabs across separate Chrome Windows, just not in the same one.

options_advanced_close_duplicate_origina.message: This only affects directly opened links (click). Duplicate links opened in background tab (ctrl/cmd+click) or in a new window (shift+click) do not close the current tab.
Close tab when a link to an already open tab is opened.

options_advanced_move_original_tab_info.message:
The default behaviour immitates the expected Chrome behaviour - the existing tab is moved to where the duplicate tab would have appeared. This is usually the position after the tab where link was opened.

An alternative is to move the existing tab to last position in its window, to make it easier to find.

options_advanced_move_original_tab_messa.message: This setting controls the tab location where the already-open tab appears when a duplicate link is opened.

options_advanced_move_original_tab_optio.message: Recommended: Move existing tab to where duplicate would have appeared
Move existing tab to last position in window

options_advanced_refresh_original_tab_la.message: Refresh existing tab when switching to it after closing a duplicate. (Not Recommended)

options_advanced_start_state_info.message:
Some public wifi networks redirect all websites to their own webpage till you login, or accept their terms. This can cause all tabs to redirect to the same page. Since they are all dulpicates now, the extension closes all but one of them.

If you frequently use such public Wifi networks, you may set this setting to 'Start switched off'.

Alternatively, you may use the 'Restore all tabs from startup' action to retore all open tabs after logging-in to the Wifi. This action is available by right-clicking the extension button, and in the extension popup.

options_advanced_tab_count_limit_info.message:
Apply a limit on number of tabs that can be opened at one time. When the limit is exceeded, Clutter Free will nag-notify (soft limit) you to either close a tab or increase the limit. Applying a hard limit will block you from opening any new tabs beyond the specified limit. The limit applies to number of open tabs across all windows, excluding incognito tabs.

If the setting to show number of open tabs is enabled, the extension buttons's counter background will change to indicate number of tabs—red if over limit, amber if close to limit, else normal.

Tab limits will be a supporter-only feature when it is out of experimental features.

options_advanced_tab_count_limit_style_b.message: Hard limit—Block new tabs when limit is reached. (not yet ready)

options_advanced_tab_count_limit_style_n.message: Soft limit—Notify when limit is reached

options_advanced_url_matching_message.message: Safer way to ignore hash or query parameters only on selected websites. Customise ignore query and ignore hash behaviour for specific URLs.

options_allow_list_add_title.message: Add URLs of pages or domains to the allow list

options_allow_list_remove_title.message: Select items to remove from the allow list

options_aum_add_url_info.message:
URL matches include sub-paths.

For example, the settings for docs.google.com will also apply on all Google Sheets (docs.google.com/spreadsheets/...), Google Slides (docs.google.com/presentation/...), and Google Docs (docs.google.com/document/...). But if the setting is just for Google Sheets (docs.google.com/spreadsheets), it will not apply to Docs, Slides and other sub-paths.

options_identity_message.message:
Subscriptions are associated with the email address used for sign-in in Chrome. All browsers signed in with this email address will have access to supporter features.

This email address is only shared with Stripe when you sign up for a subscription. Subscriptions are not available if you are not signed-in to the browser, or the email address is not available for another reason.

options_ignore_hash_label.message: Close tabs with same base URLs but different hash as duplicates. (Please be sure!)

options_ignore_hash_message.message: When ignore hash is enabled, same URLs with different hash fragments are considered duplicates. This may interfere with many modern web apps which hash fragments to indicate different destinations within the same app. Enabling ignore hash may cause non-identical pages to close as duplicates on these web apps.

options_ignore_query_label.message: Close tabs with same base URLs but different query parameters as duplicates. (Not Recommended.)

options_ignore_query_message.message: When ignore query is enabled, same URLs with different query sections are considered duplicates. Query fragments are widely used to refer to different pages within the same website, specially while searching. Enabling ignore query may cause non-identical pages to close as duplicates.

options_import_settings_notice.message: Please ensure the imported file has not been modified. Changes made to the file outside the extension can cause an import to fail. A modified file may also cause the extension to stop working.

options_notifications_notice.message:
Notifiction styles

Clutter Free style
Notifications appear inside the browser, on the webpage. They may be less intrusive than Chrome notifications, and are pertinent to the action.
 
Chrome style
Uses native desktop notifications which appear like all other app notifications. Notifications appear on the desktop, and in the notification center on macOS, Windows 10, Chrome OS, and Gnome Linux desktops.

originalTabBehaviourDivHelp.description: Help text for showContextMenu section of settings
originalTabBehaviourDivHelp.message:
This setting defines what happens when you click on a link that is already open in another tab.

You can use this setting to change this behaviour to:

  1. Leave current tab as it is, and switch to tab where the link is open (Default)
  2. Close current tab, then switch to tab where the link is open
  3. Stay on source tab, while closing the duplicate target tab in the background

refreshOriginalDivHelp.description: Help text for refreshOriginalDivHelp section of settings
refreshOriginalDivHelp.message:
When this setting is checked, the original page is refreshed after closing a duplicate.

This is useful when most duplicates are opened to check latest/updated information, news, scores, etc, without realising the page is already open in another tab. On closing the duplicate, the original page is refreshed ensuring you get the latest, updated information.

However, this can also lead to data loss if the original page had unsaved data - filled in forms, blog posts, etc. This data may be lost when the page is refreshed.

Changing this setting may lead to data loss in certain cases.

section_explanation_list_control_mode.message:
Two modes of control are available:

Allow list
Clutter Free will prevent duplicates of all pages, except those in the allow list.
 
Block list
Clutter Free will prevent duplicates only for pages and domains specified in the block list.

section_message_block_list.message: List of pages and domains which are not allowed to have duplicates tabs. All other webpages and sites will be allowed to have duplicate tabs.

section_message_domain_block_list.message: List of domains which are allowed to have only a single webpage open at any time.

section_message_list_control_mode.message: Control websites and pages for which Clutter Free prevents duplicates.

section_subtitle_block_list_remove.message: Select items to remove from the block list

section_subtitle_domain_block_list_add.message: Add URLs of domains or subdomains to block ('www.' is ignored as a subdomain)

section_subtitle_domain_block_list_remov.message: Select and remove domains from blocklist

section_title_advanced_url_matching.message: Ignore hash and query on selected websites <sup>βeta</sup>

showContextMenuDivHelp.description: Help text for showContextMenu section of settings
showContextMenuDivHelp.message:
By default, the extension adds an option in context (right-click) menu to duplicate current tab.

You can use this setting to change the right-click menu behaviour to:

  1. Duplicate current tab
  2. Add current tab's URL to the allow list
  3. Remove right-click menu completely

showCountDivHelp.description: Help text for showCountDivHelp section of settings
showCountDivHelp.message:
Show number of open tabs on the browser button. (Default on).

When enabled, shows a number - the count of open tabs - on a the extension's button. When disabled, shows no badge.

showNotificationsDivHelp.description: Help text for showNotifications section of settings
showNotificationsDivHelp.message:
Enable, or disable, notifications for following actions:

  1. Updating allow list with new items
  2. Tabs restored from startup (using popup menu)

Doesn't impact any notifications forced through when there are major updates to the extension.

startStateDivHelp.description: Help text for startState section of settings
startStateDivHelp.message:
Default behaviour is for the extension to start in switched ON state. However, under certain circumstances, this can cause data loss:

1. If there are duplicate pages open from a previous session, they'll be closed on startup.

2. If you are connecting using a network which redirects pages to a login (or accept terms) page, this may result in all but one tabs being closed as duplicates (since all are redirected to the same URL).

In each of these cases, the closed tabs can be restored quickly by using the 'Restore all tabs from startup' option in the extension's browser button.

If you encounter these issues regularly, you may change the default behaviour of the extension to start in switched OFF state.
